title: App crashes when trying to access settings
body:
# Actual behaviour

After the update to 2.7.0-beta.1 the App crashes when trying to access settings. The App closes and a popup window appears stating "Owncloud stopped"

# Expected behaviour

Settings should be accessible.

# Steps to reproduce

1. Open the app
2. Go to settings
3. App stops

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
N/A

# Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S5 mini

ownCloud app version: 2.7.0-beta.1

title: Feature Request Show the video being played even if the app has been closed.
body:
### Actual behaviour
When the user plays a video and closes the app using the home button the video stops playing and the app closes.

### Expected behaviour
When the user presses the home button the video should continue playing on a small window that can be drawn on other apps.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Play a video that has been uploaded to ownCloud
2. Press the home button.


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
 Yes

### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: Oneplus 3T

ownCloud app version: 2.6.0

title: FR: Retry failed camera uploads
body:
A user review on GooglePlayStore requested a feature:

"Image upload still does not work reliably, not in 2.6 and is actually my most important feature. As far as I was happy, everything worked as it should.  I was actually satisfied so far, everything worked as it should. Now I've had the problem for a long time that the photo upload to the InstantUpload directory always fails, especially because then simply ceases to upload the images, which is very unreliable. As if the trigger is lost in the system (Samsung S6 Edge and now Samsung S8). It would be OK if a second attempt would be made later to upload the picture again, but here this breaks completely away, so that not all my photos arrive in the InstantUpload."

Could this be implemented into the app?

title: FR: Upload Speed Limit
body:
A user review on GooglePlayStore requested a feature:

"Great app. Just missing upload speed limit, every time I make a video it kills my internet for several minutes."

Could this be implemented into the app?

title: Camera Upload (2.6.0) does not work on Android 5.1.1
body:
### Actual behaviour

After updating from 2.2 to 2.6 CERNBox branded Android App (Alpha testing channel) the photo upload functionality got broken for me on Android version 5.1.1

However, I have a report from another tester that Camera Upload works for them on Android version 8.0.0.

### Expected behaviour

I expect the photo to be uploaded. I also expect to see it in the "Uploads" list. 

Related: I read that you are polling every 15 minutes - is there a way of uploading a selected photo faster? Very often you want to share or use it from the server immediately.

title: New downloaded/offline available icons + pins
body: Through [this](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2081) issue here we came to the conclusion that we might need new pin designs in order to keep UI consistence. We tried to take an approach equal to what was suggested [here](https://github.com/owncloud/ios/issues/927) for the iOS version. Instead of showing two labels when a file is marked offline available and downloaded we only show the marked as offline available, since that will make sure that the file is downloaded anyway. ### This is what it would look like

body: Implements #2139

title: add fix for av offline flag gets removed when file gets renamed
body: The will make the "available offline" flag keep being there even if the file got renamed remotely.

title: Movingfile remotly delets it and remove avoffline flag
body: Basically all the local information about a file is lost when its moved remotely. This is because the client does not now weather the file has been deleted or just moved. In order to support keeping the file locally the client had to ask the server what happened to the file.

title: FileObserverService: use startForegroundService on Oreo and later
body:
### Actual behaviour
The ownCloud Android app crashes

### Expected behaviour
The ownCloud Android app shouldn't crash
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install the ownCloud Android app.
2. Login.
3. Restart the device.
4. Wait 10-15 seconds.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
Yes

### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: Nexus 5X

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.6.0

### Research by @invisiblek:

In API 26 and higher, startForegroundService needs to be used. This fixes the following crash upon device boot:

```
AndroidRuntime: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start receiver com.owncloud.android.broadcastreceivers.BootupBroadcastReceiver: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Not allowed to start service Intent
{ act=com.owncloud.android.services.observer.FileObserverService.action.START_OBSERVATION cmp=com.owncloud.android/.services.observer.FileObserverService }:
app is in background uid UidRecord{783d156 u0a93 RCVR idle change:uncached procs:1 seq(0,0,0)}
```

Reference: https://developer.android.com/about/versions/oreo/background.html#migration

Related: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2110

title: Migrate to Gradle 3.1.2 and add Java 8 support
body:
We are currently using Android plugin for Gradle 2.3.3, but there is a newer Android plugin for Gradle with version 3.1.2 that could be used along with 4.4 gradle distribution.

Following [Migrate to Android Plugin for Gradle 3.0.0](https://developer.android.com/studio/build/gradle-plugin-3-0-0-migration.html#manifestOutputFile) and [Use Java 8 Language Features](https://developer.android.com/studio/write/java8-support.html)

Some errors:
- [x] `Cannot set the value of read-only property 'outputFile'` -> Use `outputFileName`
- [x] `InstrumentTest deprecated` -> Use `androidTest`
- [x] `Error:(161, 5) error: invalid parent reference 'style/Widget.AppCompat.ButtonBar.AlertDialog'.` -> Use `@style` instead of `style`
- [x] `Could not find com.android.tools.lint:lint-gradle Android Studio 3`-> Include `google()` repository
- [x] Some styles not found -> remove @ before android
- [x] app_name / other setup.xml variable is not translated -> `disable 'MissingTranslation'`

Some warnings:
- [x] `Warning:Configuration 'compile' is obsolete and has been replaced with 'implementation' and 'api'.`
- [x] `Warning:Configuration 'testCompile' is obsolete and has been replaced with 'testImplementation' and 'testApi'.`
- [x] `Warning:The specified Android SDK Build Tools version (26.0.2) is ignored, as it is below the minimum supported version (27.0.3) for Android Gradle Plugin 3.1.2.` -> remove "buildToolsVersion '26.0.0'" from your build.gradle file, as **each version of the Android Gradle Plugin now has a default version of the build tools.**

It would be great to include a wizard with several steps to explain to the user not only the app main features but the new features we are including in the app. 

In a first phase, this wizard could appear the first time the app is installed and later, we can show it with new features added in every app update, if any. 

Have a look at the next gif got from [this project](https://github.com/matrixxun/ProductTour) that includes a wizard example we can use:

![run3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/34817675-dc77059a-f6b8-11e7-896f-5b000291c7d4.gif)

title: [UI] Hide loading bar gap when no syncing action is being performed
body: ### Actual behaviour - When the user scrolls down in the list of files, the loading bar gap appears always. . ### Expected behaviour - Loading bar disappears if the user is not syncing the files and show a color gradiant instead. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Have a list of files that don't fit completely in the screen. 2. Scroll down. 3. Have a look at the bottom of the list, just below the top bar. ### Environment data Android version: 6.0 Device model: Nexus 5 Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.5.0 ownCloud server version: it doesn't matter.

title: Go back camera uploads
body:
With this PR we are going to revert the last changes applied for camera uploads feature, but in a safe way, without rewriting the commits history, just in case we need some of that implementation in the future.

Taking into account [this comment](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2062#issuecomment-354288647), I have gone from [Pics never uploaded commit](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2062/commits/ed25e084f89a9f2613630eee17e1fbf7a26a795d) and included a new dialog to ask the user to confirm camera uploads disabling.

title: Revert camera uploads changes [WIP]
body:
With this PR we are going to revert the last changes applied for camera uploads feature, but in a safe way, without rewriting the commits history, just in case we need some of that implementation in the future.

Taking into account [this comment](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2062#issuecomment-354288647), I have gone from [Pics never uploaded commit](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2062/commits/ed25e084f89a9f2613630eee17e1fbf7a26a795d) and included a new dialog to ask the user to confirm camera uploads disabling.

title: Confusing download buttons when mixed
body:
### Steps

1. Enter folder with multiple files where **none** of the files were ever synced
2. Touch and hold on each file to select them
3. Find the option for "available offline" in the top bar

### Expected result
Easy to distinguish icons with no ambiguity

### Actual result
There are two icons there: an arrow down and another arrow down with an underline. I suspect that many people would not know which one to pick.

Maybe find a better icon for available offline.

### Version
2.5.0

title: Display file size during upload
body:
### Steps

1. Select multiple files for upload
1. Go to uploads section

### Expected
File sizes displayed for all files

### Actual
size only displayed for files not currently uploading. For any file currently uploading or waiting for upload, the size is hidden. Why ?

My use case is that I'm uploading on a slow network and would like to be able to estimate how long I need to wait until I can stop forcing the phone to leave WiFi on by using the phone (because wifi auto disconnects and resuming loses progress, there's another ticket for that).

Even better would be to show how much was already uploaded vs bytes total. I believe the desktop client does that. Optional is a speed measurement.

### Version
2.5.0

title: share feature does not recognise server version
body:
App version 2.5.0 does not recognise the 10.x server version. Server is 10.0.3 while app says "min. 8.2 version has to installed on server to share".

Therefore no _additional_ sharing is possible. 
Usernames which were added to the share list earlier are listed and can be deleted. Creating a share link works, too. 

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
Not possible to test because there are no other local users on this test installation to share with.


### Environment data
Android version: 13.0

Device model: maguro

Stock or customized system: lineageos

ownCloud app version: 2.5.0

ownCloud server version: 10.0.3

title: Resuming chunked uploads
body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Prepare a big video files
2. Upload big video files
3. Disconnect from network
4. Wait for error
5. Connect again
6. Wait

### Expected result
Upload resumes from last starting point (takes less time)

### Actual result
Upload does not resume (see https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2069) or would restart transfer from scratch.

### Versions
Android app 2.5.0
Android 5.1.1

The mobile app should use the new chunking endpoint:

- MKCOL http://localhost/owncloud/remote.php/dav/uploads/$userId/$transferId/
- PUT chunk 1 to http://localhost/owncloud/remote.php/dav/uploads/$userId/$transferId/0
- PUT chunk 2 to http://localhost/owncloud/remote.php/dav/uploads/$userId/$transferId/1
- PUT chunk 3 to http://localhost/owncloud/remote.php/dav/uploads/$userId/$transferId/2
- ...
- PUT chunk 999 to http://localhost/owncloud/remote.php/dav/uploads/$userId/$transferId/1000 (the chunk number can be any number but must be integer and the order must be correct)
- MOVE http://localhost/owncloud/remote.php/dav/uploads/$userId/$transferId/.file to Destination: remote.php/dav/files/$userId/target/path/finalfile.dat

The idea is to just resume uploading the failed chunks and assume the other chunks are still on the server.

Beware that if no chunk upload is happening within more than 2 days, the transfer folder will not exist any more and old chunks are deleted. So if you get a 404 on PUT, assume the transfer was cancelled and start over.

**Related:** https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1400

title: Resume upload after reconnecting to network
body:
### Steps

1. Prepare a huge video file
2. Upload video file
3. Disconnect wifi
4. Wait for error
5. Reconnect wifi
6. Wait

### Expected
Video file uploaded again

### Actual
Video file not uploaded

### Versions
Android 5.1.1
ownCloud Android App 2.5.0

Note that if I have a series of small files it seems to resume the upload list.
Maybe it does continune with the next item but does not resume failed ones ?

@davigonz

title: still cannot login
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Cannot login with app. After testing the connection and entering credentials, I am taken back to the login screen.

### Environment data
Android version: 4.3
Device model: Samsung Note 3
ownCloud app version: ownCloud beta 2.5.1-beta-1
ownCloud server version: latest, cannot check now
I don't have the logs, anyway this behavior is repeated both with the ownCloud server they set up at work and with my personal one. 
Notice that in both instances Solid Explorer can login and access the files without a problem, though it doesn't have a sync function. 
The Windows client also works without a problem on both servers.

p.s. I'm using the beta version because it seems that you have to pay for the regular one... I don't want to pay only because this app never really worked for me, every time I go back to it to check, I just cannot login. Although in a previous version it would crash on the attempt, so that's somewhat of an improvement.

title: Add touchImageView source code
body:
Necessary to include future beta versions in F-Droid since .jar files are no longer allowed. 

See this line in [F-Droid inclusion policy](https://f-droid.org/docs/Inclusion_Policy/?title=Inclusion_Policy): 
> Binary dependencies such as JAR files have to be replaced by source-built versions or used from a trusted repository (see manual).

Discussion opened: https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/merge_requests/2657
